citeinfo.origin: United States Environmental Protection Agency - Office of Environmental Information (OEI)
citeinfo.title: U.S. EPA Metadata Editor (EME) Version 3.2.1

descript.abstract: The EPA Metadata Editor (EME) allows users to create geospatial metadata that meets EPA's requirements. The tool has been developed as a desktop application that works as a standalone tool or as an extension to ESRI's ArcCatalog. It provides a customized editing environment that allows users to select EPA defaults within the user interface, while also allowing users flexibility to specify their own defaults.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this tool is to allow EPA geospatial analysts to create metadata that meets EPA requirements more easily.
descript.supplinf: This is an EPA-Produced Application. It is one in a series of enterprise geospatial resources published by USEPA. Additional applications, data, and services can be found at the http://www.epa.gov/geospatial/ website.

idinfo.useconst: None. In such proceedings, the specific language of the relevant regulation or statute is binding. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.
